IJSonObj

Defines an interface to our basic JSON object returned by the parser.

Module

import Parsers.JSon.IJsonParser

Functions
AddElement
virtual void AddElement(
IJSonObj* 
pValue
) = 0

Adds a child element to this element (assumes it is either a map or array object)

Parameters
pValue
IJSonObj*

value to add

GetName
virtual std::string GetName() = 0

Returns the name of the object

GetType
virtual CJSonType GetType() = 0

Returns type of the JSON object

GetValue
virtual std::any GetValue() = 0

Returns the value of the JSON object

FindObj
virtual CRefObj<IJSonObj> FindObj(
IJSonObj* 
pRootObj,
std::
string 
nameToFind
) = 0

Walks the JSon document starting at the specified root in search of the node specified by 'nameToFind'. 'nameToFind' should use the path format "name/subname/...".

Parameters
pRootObj
IJSonObj*

root of source to search

nameToFind
std::string

path of object to find

FindValue_String
virtual std::string FindValue_String(
std::
string 
name
) = 0

Searches the JSON DOM in search of the specified object and returns that object's value, which is expected to be a string

Parameters
name
std::string

name of object path to find
